group_1.textLeft: Living in a castle town is interesting.

group_1.textRight: Is it? It seems like any other town.

group_1.textLeft: You live up in that mansion of yours,@so you wouldn't get it.
But with so many people around here, it's easy@to get a feel for what's going on in general.

group_1.textRight: Ah yes, I see what you mean.
Certainly in a well-populated town, it's easy@to notice shifts in the general mood.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, you get it.
People are in way better spirits now than@they were during the worst of the famine.

group_1.textRight: *Giggle* Indeed.
Everyone looks so much brighter than@they did back then.
The Demons have been dwindling in number@these days as well. As the princess, I'm relieved.

group_1.textLeft: Well, I just hope things don't go sideways@again.

group_1.textRight: Indeed.

group_1.textCenter: You two must be the Battle Shamanesses!

group_1.textLeft: [chara:104601:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Hm?!

group_1.textRight: You must be…
Ah yes, you're the resident physician's@daughter.
Yes, I am…!
I know making requests of you goes way@beyond my station, but I'm desperate!

group_1.textLeft: You may ask. I'll do whatever I can to help.

group_1.textRight: Then please…!
Please watch my baby for the time being!

group_1.textLeft: The hell?! A baby?!
W-wait a second!
I can't be entrusted with a baby@all of a sudden…!

group_1.textRight: It's an emergency! I need to hurry and@prepare medicine in my father's stead.
I don't have any relatives I can leave@my son with, so I was at a loss…
But you two are the Battle Shamanesses!@I know I can trust you!

group_1.textLeft: Whaaaa…?
Were I more knowledgeable on medicine, I'd handle@that, but I'm not of much use in that department…

group_1.textRight: I need to leave now. Please take care@of my son!
I'll leave you some mochi cakes in return!
WAIT!

group_1.textLeft: I didn't sign up to be the neighborhood@handyman...

group_1.textRight: Look, Chizuru! He's delighted by the game@he and I were playing!

group_1.textLeft: No, clearly he was laughing at watching@me juggle.

group_1.textRight: Excuse me? It was certainly my game@he was enjoying.

group_1.textLeft: Nope, it was mine.
Look, I train the kids back in the village.
I'm practically a big sis to 'em. Don't underestimate@how good I am with kids.

group_1.textRight: I've played with my young relatives@as well…!

group_1.textLeft: You're the princess, though. Aren't YOU@the one always getting babied?

group_1.textRight: Don't treat me like a child...!

group_1.textLeft: Look, if you're that pouty about it, why@don't we have a little competition?

group_1.textRight: Alright, what do you have in mind?

group_1.textLeft: I dunno why babies think this is so awesome,@but for some reason,
if you hide your face for a sec and then suddenly@show it to 'em, they get a big kick out of it.

group_1.textRight: Ah…that game? Of course I know it.

group_1.textLeft: Do you really…?
Well, whatever.
So let's play that game. Whoever gets a bigger@laugh out of the little guy is the winner.

group_1.textRight: To put it simply…
And then you reveal it, yes?

group_1.textLeft: Got it in one.
Alright, let's get on with it.

group_1.textRight: Right.
[chara:104501:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]Hah!

group_1.textLeft: [chara:104601:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]Yah!

group_1.textRight: [chara:104501:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]THE BABY IS GONE!

group_1.textLeft: I can see that for myself, dammit!
